column3: This is a magnificent edifice, in beautiful brick and tile and Romanesque style. Inspired by the Milanese Basilica di Sant’Ambrogio it was completed in 1929.A marvellous façade has the defining double towers. The name honours Josiah Royce a Californian philosopher who graduated from a sister UC in 1875.Down the decades the Hall has hosted all the greats of American music and performance, including George Gershwin, Duke Ellington, Frank Sinatra and Leonard Bernstein.
